meanings.definition: A slight periodic wobble in the axis of a rotating body, such as a planet or gyroscope.
meanings.sent1: The nutation of the Earth's axis affects its climate over long periods.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nutation of the gyroscope to understand its stability.
meanings.sent3: During the dance, the nutation of the dancer's head added a unique flair to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The nutation of the planet's axis created a mesmerizing pattern in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The nutation of the gyroscope was so subtle, it required precise instruments to detect.

meanings.definition: The act of nodding or making a slight movement back and forth.
meanings.sent1: She greeted him with a friendly nutation of her head.
meanings.sent2: The nutation of the tree branches in the wind was calming to watch.
meanings.sent3: The nutation of the bobblehead toy made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His nutation in agreement showed his approval without words.
meanings.sent5: The nutation of the metronome kept the musicians in perfect time.
